thread.title: Newcastle United freeze season ticket prices for 2017/18
thread.title_full: Newcastle United freeze season ticket prices for 2017/18 | Tyne Tees - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Newcastle United freeze season ticket prices for 2017/18
text:
Newcastle United have confirmed that prices for existing season ticket holders will be frozen for the 2017/18 season.
The announcement comes as United see themselves restored to the top spot in the league, following a win against Derby at the weekend.
The club will notify supporters on long-term price freeze deals later this week to confirm their price schedule for the 2017/18 season.
Fans on one-year and half-season deals will be able to renew at the current one-year price later in the season.
We wanted to help repay their incredible loyalty with a price freeze for all existing season ticket holders, meaning the price they’ll pay in 2017/18 will be exactly the same as the price they paid for their 2016/17 season ticket."
– Lee Charnley, managing director at Newcastle United In 2015/16, the Magpies reduced season ticket prices for supporters under the age of 18 and an additional 10% discount for all season tickets when it was confirmed the club would spend 2016/17 in the Championship. Season ticket holder numbers have since risen close to 38,000.
Last updated Tue 7 Feb 2017 Sport Newcastle United Newcastle
